TITLE: Berkshire Hathaway’s big mystery stock wager could be revealed soon
SUMMARY: Warren Buffett's bet, shrouded in mystery, has captivated Berkshire Hathaway investors since first appearing in disclosures late last year.

TITLE: Amgen stock soars on weight loss injection progress as Novo Nordisk, Eli Lilly shares slide
SUMMARY: Amgen's update fueled concerns about potential new competition in the weight loss drug market, sending shares of Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly lower.

TITLE: Skydance bid for Paramount hinges on Shari Redstone as special committee ends exclusive talks
SUMMARY: Skydance is likely to walk away from its Paramount offer unless controlling shareholder Shari Redstone reaffirms her commitment following the Apollo-Sony bid.

TITLE: Immigrant workers are helping boost the U.S. labor market
SUMMARY: The government predicts that the influx of immigrant workers will grow gross domestic product over the next decade by $7 trillion.

TITLE: Dave & Buster's plan to allow betting on arcade games draws scrutiny
SUMMARY: An Illinois lawmaker is proposing legislation to prevent wagering at family entertainment venues, saying such companies don't have proper safeguards in place.

TITLE: Talent war between family offices and Wall Street drives up salaries
SUMMARY: Wealthy families are spending an average of $3 million to run their family offices, according to a J.P. Morgan Private report, and the biggest cost is staffing.

TITLE: Amgen scraps experimental weight loss pill, moves forward with injection
SUMMARY: Amgen is among several drugmakers racing to join the red-hot weight loss drug space dominated by Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.

TITLE: Wayfair shares surge after furniture retailer cuts losses by more than $100 million
SUMMARY: Wayfair's sales fell in the first quarter, but the furniture retailer narrowed its losses by over $100 million after cutting 13% of its staff.

TITLE: Sony and Apollo send letter expressing interest in $26 billion Paramount buyout as company mulls Skydance bid
SUMMARY: Sony and Apollo showed formal interest in a Paramount Global buyout as Paramount's special committee is prepared to give its recommendation to Skydance.

TITLE: Long-predicted consumer pullback finally hits restaurants like Starbucks, KFC and McDonald's
SUMMARY: Starbucks, Pizza Hut and KFC are among the chains that reported same-store sales declines this quarter.

TITLE: Peloton CEO Barry McCarthy to step down, company to lay off 15% of staff as it looks to refinance debt
SUMMARY: Peloton announced Thursday that CEO Barry McCarthy will be stepping down just over two years after he took over from founder John Foley.

TITLE: Moderna loses less than expected as Covid vaccine sales beat estimates, cost cuts take hold
SUMMARY: The company reiterated its full-year 2024 sales guidance of roughly $4 billion, which includes revenue from the expected launch of its RSV vaccine.

TITLE: Carvana shares spike 30% as used car retailer posts record first quarter
SUMMARY: Carvana reported record first-quarter results Wednesday that beat Wall Street's top- and bottom-line earnings expectations for the online used car retailer.

TITLE: CVS shares plummet as health company slashes profit outlook on higher medical costs
SUMMARY: CVS and other insurers have seen medical costs spike as many Medicare Advantage patients return to hospitals to undergo procedures they delayed during Covid.

TITLE: Bally Sports regional networks go dark for Comcast cable customers
SUMMARY: Carriage negotiations between Comcast and Diamond Sports broke down, leaving cable customers without access to Bally Sports regional networks during MLB season.

TITLE: Yum Brands earnings miss estimates as Pizza Hut, KFC sales disappoint
SUMMARY: KFC and Pizza Hut reported same-store sales declines, while Taco Bell's same-store sales rose just 1%.

TITLE: Pfizer beats earnings estimates, raises outlook on cost cuts and smaller-than-feared drop in Covid drug sales
SUMMARY: The pharmaceutical giant's quarterly results also benefited from a smaller-than-feared drop in sales for its Covid antiviral pill Paxlovid.

TITLE: Johnson & Johnson to pay $6.5 billion to resolve nearly all talc ovarian cancer lawsuits in U.S.
SUMMARY: The deal would allow J&J to resolve the lawsuits through a third bankruptcy filing of a subsidiary company, LTL Management.

TITLE: Viking shares rise 8% after cruise line operator's market debut
SUMMARY: The company's initial public offering coincides with a strong rebound in cruise bookings.

TITLE: NYCB shares jump 30% after CEO gives two-year plan for 'clear path to profitability'
SUMMARY: CEO Joseph Otting took over NYCB in April after an investor group led by former Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin injected more than $1 billion into the lender.

TITLE: To train car dealers on EVs and other topics, Ford turns to gamification and AI-powered education
SUMMARY: Dealership employees, who are employed outside Ford by dealers, are crucial for the company's sales, performance and customer engagement and satisfaction.

TITLE: Starbucks shares sink 12% as coffee chain slashes 2024 forecast amid same-store sales drag
SUMMARY: Across all regions, Starbucks reported shrinking same-store sales and falling traffic.

TITLE: FTC challenges 'junk' patents held by 10 drugmakers, including for Novo Nordisk's Ozempic
SUMMARY: The agency sent letters to Novo Nordisk, AstraZeneca, Boehringer Ingelheim, Covis Pharma, GlaxoSmithKline, Novartis, Teva Pharmaceuticals, among others.

TITLE: NBC Sports could buy back rights to iconic theme song 'Roundball Rock' if it airs NBA games again, composer John Tesh says
SUMMARY: NBC Sports can license the rights to John Tesh's famous "Roundball Rock" theme song if it secures a new NBA media package, Tesh said in an e-mail.

TITLE: Coca-Cola tops earnings estimates, hikes revenue outlook on higher prices
SUMMARY: Shares of Coke have fallen 3.5% over the last year, dragging the company's market value down to $267 billion.

TITLE: McDonald’s earnings miss estimates as diners pull back, Middle East boycotts hit sales
SUMMARY: McDonald's shares have fallen 7.5% over the last year, dragging its market value down to $197 billion.

TITLE: Eli Lilly beats on quarterly profit, hikes full-year guidance on strong sales of Zepbound, Mounjaro
SUMMARY: Zepbound reported $517.4 million in sales for the quarter, even as most doses of the drug slipped into shortages in the U.S.

TITLE: Walmart to shutter health centers, virtual care service in latest failed push into health care
SUMMARY: Walmart said clinics are not a sustainable business model due to a challenging reimbursement environment for primary care and increasing operating costs.

TITLE: Home prices soar even higher in February, despite higher mortgage rates, says S&P Case-Shiller
SUMMARY: It marked another increase after the prior month's annual gain of 6%, and the fastest rate of price growth since November 2022.

TITLE: Walmart launches new grocery brand, as it tries to hang on to inflation-fueled growth
SUMMARY: The nation's largest grocer sees room to build on its inflation-fueled grocery gains.
